Michael Silverstein wrote:

> I agree that you should strive to write code that does not
> need comments, however some times it is unavoidable. One
> prime example is where you are driven to make a design
> decision that runs counter to 'common sense' and must
> indicate why in order to keep people from wrongly rewriting
> the code in the future. This often happens when trying to
> accommodate a framework or hardware that doesn't quite work as
> advertised. 

The early JAXB implementation had a bug so that you needed to use a
special ClassLoaderProxy in some cases. The only comment I felt the need
to write was an Eclipse TODO task tag, remembering me to remove the
workaround for later releases.

Take care, Ilja
